comments.author: petr@pada.cz
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20110901 Firefox/6.0 SeaMonkey/2.3.1
Build ID: 20110901160848




Expected results:

This is a feature request. Although the location bar autocomplete algorithm can search in tags and bookmarks, it does not display these values in results. I would like to see implemented rich result popup (Firefox-like), probably with option to disable it for people who don't like this.
Main drawbacks of current implementation are:
1) Matched string is not highlighted, so it's hard to see why a certain page is shown.
2) It does not display tags, so it's possible that in results you get a page that does not have typed string neither in URL, nor in title (but in tag name) - this is confusing.
3) Bookmarked items are not marked in any way.

Personally I like the Firefox style of displaying location bar autocomplete results (I had no idea how much, until I moved to Seamonkey :)).
comments.creator: petr@pada.cz

Build ID: 20110901160848




Expected results:

This is a feature request. Although the location bar autocomplete algorithm can search in tags and bookmarks, it does not display these values in results. I would like to see implemented rich result popup (Firefox-like), probably with option to disable it for people who don't like this.
Main drawbacks of current implementation are:
1) Matched string is not highlighted, so it's hard to see why a certain page is shown.
2) It does not display tags, so it's possible that in results you get a page that does not have typed string neither in URL, nor in title (but in tag name) - this is confusing.
3) Bookmarked items are not marked in any way.

Personally I like the Firefox style of displaying location bar autocomplete results (I had no idea how much, until I moved to Seamonkey :)).
In what version was this supposed to be implemented? Just tried 2.12.1 and nothing here.

comments.raw_text: It is impossible to handle such "make SeaMonkey a better internet suite, so I make this one a meta and file separate Bugs for the "Highlighting" issue and others.
